unnormalised: Reliance Retail reported a Q1 sales jump of 25%, mainly driven by apparel and electronics. Apparently, folks are finally ditching those old smartphones! Analysts estimate that the average spend per customer went up by 15% this quarter. Wonder what everyone’s buying?
normalised: Reliance Retail reported a Q one sales jump of twenty five percent, mainly driven by apparel and electronics. Apparently, folks are finally ditching those old smartphones! Analysts estimate that the average spend per customer went up by fifteen percent this quarter. Wonder what everyone’s buying?

unnormalised: Turns out, most of that increase comes from online grocery orders placed via JioMart. Who knew everyone was suddenly so into cooking? Also seeing a lot of action in the fashion segment; Lifestyle and Trends stores had a good run. One saree enthusiast shelled out Rs. 25,000 on a single purchase – talk about retail therapy!

unnormalised: Small kirana stores are apparently also seeing some love, thanks to Reliance’s B2B platform. Reportedly, over 200,000 stores are now using it to stock up on essentials. Maybe this digital push is what they needed to compete with the big guys. And hey, more options are always good for us consumers, right?

unnormalised: Looks like the retail sector is bouncing back strong after the pandemic. And with festive season around the corner (Diwali sales, anyone?), we can expect even bigger numbers in Q3 and Q4. I'm personally looking forward to those end-of-season sales - targeting a new laptop at 50% off!
